title: Current - particle motion in wire with no current

content.question: The figure shows a close-up view of a portion of a long, thin, horizontal wire. If the current in the wire is zero, which of the following best represents the motion of individual charge carrier particles within the wire? The arrows represent instantaneous particle velocities, and a dot with no arrow indicates a particle at rest.

choices.label: The figure shows a portion of a horizontal wire. Six random points with no arrows are indicated along the inside of the wire.

The figure shows a portion of a horizontal wire. Six points are indicated inside the wire. Three of the points have arrows that point horizontally to the left, and three points have arrows that point horizontally to the right. The lengths of the arrows vary from short to long.

The figure shows a portion of a horizontal wire. Six points are indicated inside the wire. Three of the points have arrows that point vertically upward, and three points have arrows that point vertically downward. The lengths of the arrows vary from short to long.

The figure shows a portion of a horizontal wire. Six points are indicated inside the wire. Each point has an arrow drawn from it, and the directions that the arrows point in have no pattern. The lengths of the arrows vary from short to long.

content.answer: The figure shows a portion of a horizontal wire. Six points are indicated inside the wire. Each point has an arrow drawn from it, and the directions that the arrows point in have no pattern. The lengths of the arrows vary from short to long.
